intro: Palicourea hospitalis, commonly known as the hospital plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. Palicourea hospitalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
